conclusion: Analyze the flow direction and placement of baffles to predict liquid flow into containers D, E, or F.
Baffles A, B, and C are placed to block the direct path of the liquid.
Liquid will follow the path around the baffles.
Baffle A is positioned at the top left corner.
Liquid will likely flow down and curve around Baffle A.
Baffle B is positioned horizontally near the center.
Liquid will flow horizontally across Baffle B.
Baffle C is positioned at the top right corner.
Liquid will likely flow down and curve around Baffle C.
After passing through Baffle A, liquid flows into Container D.
After passing through Baffle B, liquid flows into Container E.
After passing through Baffle C, liquid flows into Container F.
Liquid from A flows into Container D.
Liquid from B flows into Container E.
Liquid from C flows into Container F.
